title: Detroit police investigating triple shooting
content:
Detroit Police are investigating a triple shooting that happened on the city's west side Thursday evening, injuring a mother and her two teenage sons.
Sgt. Cassandra Lewis said the mother, 42, and her sons, 17 and 19, were sitting outside on the porch of a home located in the 16000 block of Cathedral Street around 6:30 p.m. when a car pulled up and about five or six males got out of the vehicle.
"They got out and started to fire shots at the victims," Lewis said. All three victims were struck by bullets, but their injuries appear to be non-life threatening, according to Lewis.
No suspect or vehicle description was immediately available from police.
